 1	import React, { useState, useEffect } from 'react';
 2	import { View, Text, StyleSheet } from 'react-native';
 3	import { COLORS } from '../../utils/constants';
 4	
 5	interface PaymentCountdownProps {
 6	 paymentDate: string; // Date du dernier paiement (format ISO)
 7	 cycleDays?: number; // Nombre de jours dans le cycle (défaut: 30)
 8	}
 9	
 10	export default function PaymentCountdown({ paymentDate, cycleDays = 30 }: PaymentCountdownProps) {
 11	 const [timeLeft, setTimeLeft] = useState({
 12	 days: 0,
 13	 hours: 0,
 14	 minutes: 0,
 15	 seconds: 0
 16	 });
 17	
 18	 useEffect(() => {
 19	 const calculateTimeLeft = () => {
 20	 const lastPayment = new Date(paymentDate);
 21	 const nextPayment = new Date(lastPayment);
 22	 nextPayment.setDate(lastPayment.getDate() + cycleDays);
 23	 
 24	 const now = new Date();
 25	 const difference = nextPayment.getTime() - now.getTime();
 26	
 27	 if (difference > 0) {
 28	 const days = Math.floor(difference / (1000 * 60 * 60 * 24));
 29	 const hours = Math.floor((difference % (1000 * 60 * 60 * 24)) / (1000 * 60 * 60));
 30	 const minutes = Math.floor((difference % (1000 * 60 * 60)) / (1000 * 60));
 31	 const seconds = Math.floor((difference % (1000 * 60)) / 1000);
 32	
 33	 setTimeLeft({ days, hours, minutes, seconds });
 34	 } else {
 35	 // Échéance dépassée
 36	 setTimeLeft({ days: 0, hours: 0, minutes: 0, seconds: 0 });
 37	 }
 38	 };
 39	
 40	 // Calculer immédiatement
 41	 calculateTimeLeft();
 42	
 43	 // Mettre à jour chaque seconde
 44	 const timer = setInterval(calculateTimeLeft, 1000);
 45	
 46	 return () => clearInterval(timer);
 47	 }, [paymentDate, cycleDays]);
 48	
 49	 const isOverdue = timeLeft.days === 0 && timeLeft.hours === 0 && timeLeft.minutes === 0 && timeLeft.seconds === 0;
 50	
 51	 return (
 52	 <View style={styles.container}>
 53	 <Text style={styles.title}>
 54	 {isOverdue ? '⚠️ Échéance dépassée' : '⏰ Prochaine échéance'}
 55	 </Text>
 56	 
 57	 {!isOverdue ? (
 58	 <View style={styles.countdownContainer}>
 59	 <View style={styles.timeBlock}>
 60	 <Text style={styles.timeNumber}>{timeLeft.days}</Text>
 61	 <Text style={styles.timeLabel}>Jours</Text>
 62	 </View>
 63	 
 64	 <Text style={styles.separator}>:</Text>
 65	 
 66	 <View style={styles.timeBlock}>
 67	 <Text style={styles.timeNumber}>{timeLeft.hours.toString().padStart(2, '0')}</Text>
 68	 <Text style={styles.timeLabel}>Heures</Text>
 69	 </View>
 70	 
 71	 <Text style={styles.separator}>:</Text>
 72	 
 73	 <View style={styles.timeBlock}>
 74	 <Text style={styles.timeNumber}>{timeLeft.minutes.toString().padStart(2, '0')}</Text>
 75	 <Text style={styles.timeLabel}>Min</Text>
 76	 </View>
 77	 </View>
 78	 ) : (
 79	 <View style={styles.overdueContainer}>
 80	 <Text style={styles.overdueText}>
 81	 Votre paiement est en retard
 82	 </Text>
 83	 <Text style={styles.overdueSubtext}>
 84	 Renouvelez votre couverture rapidement
 85	 </Text>
 86	 </View>
 87	 )}
 88	 </View>
 89	 );
 90	}
 91

Path: src/utils/dateUtils.ts
 1	/**
 2	 * Utilitaires pour la gestion des dates dans les appels API météo
 3	 */
 4	
 5	export class DateUtils {
 6	 /**
 7	 * Formate une date au format YYYY-MM-DD pour les APIs
 8	 */
 9	 static formatDateForAPI(date: Date): string {
 10	 return date.toISOString().split('T')[0];
 11	 }
 12	
 13	 /**
 14	 * Obtient la date d'aujourd'hui au format API
 15	 */
 16	 static getTodayForAPI(): string {
 17	 return this.formatDateForAPI(new Date());
 18	 }
 19	
 20	 /**
 21	 * Obtient une date X jours dans le passé
 22	 */
 23	 static getDaysAgoForAPI(days: number): string {
 24	 const date = new Date();
 25	 date.setDate(date.getDate() - days);
 26	 return this.formatDateForAPI(date);
 27	 }
 28	
 29	 /**
 30	 * Vérifie si une date est valide pour les données historiques
 31	 */
 32	 static isValidHistoricalDate(dateString: string): boolean {
 33	 const date = new Date(dateString);
 34	 const now = new Date();
 35	 const twoYearsAgo = new Date();
 36	 twoYearsAgo.setFullYear(now.getFullYear() - 2);
 37	
 38	 // La date ne doit pas être dans le futur
 39	 if (date > now) {
 40	 return false;
 41	 }
 42	
 43	 // La date ne doit pas être trop ancienne (plus de 2 ans)
 44	 if (date < twoYearsAgo) {
 45	 return false;
 46	 }
 47	
 48	 return true;
 49	 }
 50	
 51	 /**
 52	 * Obtient une plage de dates sécurisée pour les données historiques
 53	 */
 54	 static getSafeHistoricalDateRange(requestedStartDate: string, requestedEndDate: string): {
 55	 startDate: string;
 56	 endDate: string;
 57	 isAdjusted: boolean;
 58	 } {
 59	 const now = new Date();
 60	 const yesterday = new Date(now);
 61	 yesterday.setDate(yesterday.getDate() - 1);
 62	 
 63	 const oneMonthAgo = new Date(now);
 64	 oneMonthAgo.setMonth(oneMonthAgo.getMonth() - 1);
 65	
 66	 let startDate = new Date(requestedStartDate);
 67	 let endDate = new Date(requestedEndDate);
 68	 let isAdjusted = false;
 69	
 70	 // Ajuster la date de fin si elle est dans le futur
 71	 if (endDate > yesterday) {
 72	 endDate = yesterday;
 73	 isAdjusted = true;
 74	 }
 75	
 76	 // Ajuster la date de début si elle est trop ancienne
 77	 if (startDate < oneMonthAgo) {
 78	 startDate = oneMonthAgo;
 79	 isAdjusted = true;
 80	 }
 81	
 82	 // S'assurer que la date de début n'est pas après la date de fin
 83	 if (startDate > endDate) {
 84	 startDate = new Date(endDate);
 85	 startDate.setDate(startDate.getDate() - 7); // 7 jours avant la date de fin
 86	 isAdjusted = true;
 87	 }
 88	
 89	 return {
 90	 startDate: this.formatDateForAPI(startDate),
 91	 endDate: this.formatDateForAPI(endDate),
 92	 isAdjusted
 93	 };
 94	 }
 95	
 96	 /**
 97	 * Valide les coordonnées GPS
 98	 */
 99	 static validateCoordinates(lat: number, lon: number): boolean {
 100	 return lat >= -90 && lat <= 90 && lon >= -180 && lon <= 180;
 101	 }
 102	
 103	 /**
 104	 * Arrondit les coordonnées à 4 décimales pour optimiser les appels API
 105	 */
 106	 static roundCoordinates(lat: number, lon: number): { lat: number; lon: number } {
 107	 return {
 108	 lat: Math.round(lat * 10000) / 10000,
 109	 lon: Math.round(lon * 10000) / 10000
 110	 };
 111	 }
 112	}

 1	import { createSlice, createAsyncThunk, PayloadAction } from '@reduxjs/toolkit';
 2	import { Coverage, Claim, InsuranceState, WeatherAlert } from '../../types/insurance';
 3	
 4	// Actions asynchrones
 5	export const fetchCoverageStatus = createAsyncThunk(
 6	 'insurance/fetchCoverageStatus',
 7	 async (userId: string) => {
 8	 // Simulation d'un appel API
 9	 await new Promise(resolve => setTimeout(resolve, 1000));
 10	 
 11	 const coverage: Coverage = {
 12	 id: Date.now().toString(),
 13	 userId,
 14	 amount: 30000, // 30,000 FCFA
 15	 premium: 800, // 800 FCFA (maximum 1000 FCFA)
 16	 isActive: true,
 17	 startDate: new Date().toISOString(),
 18	 expiryDate: new Date(Date.now() + 365 * 24 * 60 * 60 * 1000).toISOString(),
 19	 cropType: 'maize',
 20	 farmSize: 2,
 21	 riskLevel: 0.6
 22	 };
 23	 
 24	 return coverage;
 25	 }
 26	);
 27	
 28	export const fetchWeatherAlerts = createAsyncThunk(
 29	 'insurance/fetchWeatherAlerts',
 30	 async (location: { latitude: number; longitude: number }) => {
 31	 // Simulation d'un appel API météo
 32	 await new Promise(resolve => setTimeout(resolve, 800));
 33	 
 34	 const alerts: WeatherAlert[] = [
 35	 {
 36	 id: '1',
 37	 type: 'drought',
 38	 severity: 'medium',
 39	 title: 'Risque de Sécheresse',
 40	 description: 'Température élevée (38°C) et absence de pluie depuis 5 jours. Surveillez vos cultures.',
 41	 actionRequired: true,
 42	 compensationTrigger: false,
 43	 date: new Date().toISOString()
 44	 }
 45	 ];
 46	 
 47	 return alerts;
 48	 }
 49	);
 50	
 51	export const submitClaim = createAsyncThunk(
 52	 'insurance/submitClaim',
 53	 async (claimData: Partial<Claim>) => {
 54	 // Simulation d'un appel API
 55	 await new Promise(resolve => setTimeout(resolve, 1500));
 56	 
 57	 const newClaim: Claim = {
 58	 id: Date.now().toString(),
 59	 userId: claimData.userId || '',
 60	 coverageId: claimData.coverageId || '',
 61	 type: claimData.type || 'drought',
 62	 description: claimData.description || '',
 63	 amount: claimData.amount || 0,
 64	 status: 'pending',
 65	 submissionDate: new Date().toISOString(),
 66	 evidence: claimData.evidence || []
 67	 };
 68	 
 69	 return newClaim;
 70	 }
 71	);
 72	
 73	const initialState: InsuranceState = {
 74	 coverage: null,
 75	 claims: [],
 76	 weatherAlerts: [],
 77	 loading: false,
 78	 error: null
 79	};
 80	
 81	const insuranceSlice = createSlice({
 82	 name: 'insurance',
 83	 initialState,
 84	 reducers: {
 85	 clearError: (state) => {
 86	 state.error = null;
 87	 },
 88	 addWeatherAlert: (state, action: PayloadAction<WeatherAlert>) => {
 89	 state.weatherAlerts.push(action.payload);
 90	 },
 91	 removeWeatherAlert: (state, action: PayloadAction<string>) => {
 92	 state.weatherAlerts = state.weatherAlerts.filter(
 93	 alert => alert.id !== action.payload
 94	 );
 95	 }
 96	 },
 97	 extraReducers: (builder) => {
 98	 builder
 99	 // Fetch Coverage Status
 100	 .addCase(fetchCoverageStatus.pending, (state) => {
 101	 state.loading = true;
 102	 state.error = null;
 103	 })
 104	 .addCase(fetchCoverageStatus.fulfilled, (state, action: PayloadAction<Coverage>) => {
 105	 state.loading = false;
 106	 state.coverage = action.payload;
 107	 })
 108	 .addCase(fetchCoverageStatus.rejected, (state, action) => {
 109	 state.loading = false;
 110	 state.error = action.error.message || 'Erreur lors du chargement de la couverture';
 111	 })
 112	 // Fetch Weather Alerts
 113	 .addCase(fetchWeatherAlerts.pending, (state) => {
 114	 state.loading = true;
 115	 })
 116	 .addCase(fetchWeatherAlerts.fulfilled, (state, action: PayloadAction<WeatherAlert[]>) => {
 117	 state.loading = false;
 118	 state.weatherAlerts = action.payload;
 119	 })

[API](../../../../faqs/tags/#tag:api) [Daily](../../../../faqs/tags/#tag:daily)

Daily API[¶](#daily-api "Permanent link")
=========================================

The Daily microservice API returns time series analysis ready data responses for solar and meteorological data to be used directly by applications.

* Provides parameters by day with average, maximum, and/or minimum values.
* All parameters are available in their original source spatial resolution.

Warning

If you are going to be using the Daily API to download the entire catalog please remember that with 0.5° x 0.5° global grid you only need to submit one request per cell. If your application persists is requesting the same relative location it potentially will be blocked.

Formats[¶](#formats "Permanent link")
-------------------------------------

Formats

Available

Notes

NetCDF

Yes

ASCII

Yes

ICASA

Yes

Only available for the AG Community.

JSON

Yes

CSV

Yes

Tip

If you are requesting the ICASA format via the Data Access Viewer (DAV) you do not have to select any parameters the DAV will autofill the required parameters. When using the Application Programming Interface (API) to request ICASA you need to include at least one parameter and the API will autofill the required parameters in the file response. For the monthly amplitude to be included in the file please select a time period that includes at least two months. The ICASA file responds in Local Solar Time (LST).

Time Standards[¶](#time-standards "Permanent link")
---------------------------------------------------

POWER provides two different time standards:

* Universal Time Coordinated (UTC): is the standard time measure that used by the world.
* Local Solar Time (LST): A 15 Degrees swath that represents solar noon at the middle longitude of the swath.

* Daily UTC and LST time standards data are available from 1981/01/01 to Near Real Time (NRT)
* Hourly defaults to providing LST; to change the time standard please include `time-standard=UTC` or `time-standard=LST` in the API request URL.

Limits[¶](#limits "Permanent link")
-----------------------------------

Parameters

* A maximum of 20 parameters can currently be requested in one submission for a single point. Regional requests are limited to one parameter.
* This limits does not apply if more parameters are needed by the application to construct any on the fly parameters.

Wind Elevation and Custom Surface

1. This parameter is only available with Point spatial option.
2. Wind Elevation values in Meters are required to be between 10m and 300m.
3. If you provide a correct wind surface alias `wind-surface` please include a surface elevation `wind-elevation` with the request.

For a list of wind surface aliases please use this [System API Request](/api/system/manager/surface) for more information please reference the \[Manager Documentation\](\\docs\\services\\api\\system\\manager).

Site Elevation

If you wish to pass your own site elevation (in meters) you will receive a corrected atmospheric pressure value upon adjustment to the elevation you provided.

1. This parameter is only available with Point spatial option.
2. Site Elevation `site-elevation` values in Meters.

Request Structure[¶](#request-structure "Permanent link")
---------------------------------------------------------

* The request arguments can be in any order after the question mark.
* A single parameter can be requested or a list of Parameters can be selected, with one of the following list separators: ',' or '%2C'.

### Examples[¶](#examples "Permanent link")

To help construct and test your API requests please use the API Pages for the [POWER Daily API](/api/pages/?urls.primaryName=Daily) and [POWER Manager API](/api/pages/?urls.primaryName=Manager).

#### Point[¶](#point "Permanent link")

SimpleComplexSite ElevationWind ElevationWind SurfaceAll Operations

1

`/api/temporal/daily/point?parameters=T2M&community=SB&longitude=0&latitude=0&start=20170101&end=20170201&format=JSON`

1

`/api/temporal/daily/point?parameters=T2M,PS,WS10M&community=AG&longitude=0&latitude=0&start=20170101&end=20170201&format=CSV`

1

`/api/temporal/daily/point?parameters=T2M&community=SB&longitude=0&latitude=0&start=20170101&end=20170201&format=JSON&site-elevation=50`

1

`/api/temporal/daily/point?parameters=T2M&community=AG&longitude=0&latitude=0&start=20170101&end=20170201&format=ASCII&wind-elevation=50`

1

`/api/temporal/daily/point?parameters=T2M&community=AG&longitude=0&latitude=0&start=20170101&end=20170201&format=ASCII&wind-surface=SeaIce&wind-elevation=50`

1

`/api/temporal/daily/point?parameters=T2M,PS,WS10M&community=AG&longitude=0&latitude=0&start=20170101&end=20170201&format=ASCII&wind-surface=SeaIce&wind-elevation=50&site-elevation=50`

#### Regional[¶](#regional "Permanent link")

Below are examples to return a daily data for a region on a 0.5 x 0.5 degree grid.

1
2
3

 1	import { useState, useEffect } from 'react';
 2	import { WeatherService } from '../services/weatherService';
 3	
 4	export function useWeatherData(latitude?: number, longitude?: number) {
 5	 const [weatherData, setWeatherData] = useState<any>(null);
 6	 const [riskAnalysis, setRiskAnalysis] = useState<any>(null);
 7	 const [loading, setLoading] = useState(false);
 8	 const [error, setError] = useState<string | null>(null);
 9	
 10	 const fetchWeatherData = async (cropType: string = 'maize') => {
 11	 if (!latitude || !longitude) {
 12	 setError('Coordonnées GPS requises');
 13	 return;
 14	 }
 15	
 16	 try {
 17	 setLoading(true);
 18	 setError(null);
 19	
 20	 // Récupération en parallèle (plus rapide)
 21	 const [currentWeather, riskData] = await Promise.all([
 22	 WeatherService.getCurrentWeather(latitude, longitude),
 23	 WeatherService.analyzeClimateRisk(latitude, longitude, cropType)
 24	 ]);
 25	
 26	 setWeatherData(currentWeather);
 27	 setRiskAnalysis(riskData);
 28	 } catch (err) {
 29	 const errorMessage = err instanceof Error ? err.message : 'Erreur météo inconnue';
 30	 setError(errorMessage);
 31	 console.error('Hook météo - Erreur:', errorMessage);
 32	 } finally {
 33	 setLoading(false);
 34	 }
 35	 };
 36	
 37	 // Auto-fetch au montage du composant
 38	 useEffect(() => {
 39	 if (latitude && longitude) {
 40	 fetchWeatherData();
 41	 }
 42	 }, [latitude, longitude]);
 43	
 44	 return {
 45	 weatherData,
 46	 riskAnalysis,
 47	 loading,
 48	 error,
 49	 refetch: fetchWeatherData
 50	 };
 51	}
 52
